Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Computer

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rene Borr, Roderick Zack, Jerry Abril, Felix Ruiz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Creates a default player named computer and generates their ships.
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a player and generates the ships that they will utilize.
      Player(java.lang.String name, java.util.Scanner s)
      Creates a player with a given name and scanner to take input.

      • fire

        public boolean fire(Player player,
                    char row,
                    int column)
        Utilized by the player to fire shots to the opponent and play the game.
        Parameters:
        player - Which player is firing the missile
        row - Which row (A-J) to fire at
        column - Which column (1-10) to fire at
        Returns:
        Whether the shot was successful or not

      • getRow

        public char getRow()
        Row in which the player will place their ship
        Returns:
        The row in which the player placed their ship. Between A-J.

      • getColumn

        public int getColumn()
        Column in which the player will place their ship
        Returns:
        The column in which the player placed their ship. Between 1-10.

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(Player player,
                         Ship ship,
                         char row,
                         int column,
                         java.lang.Boolean vert)
        Places a ship for a player where they desire it.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that is placing the ship
        ship - Ship number being placed
        row - The row where it's being placed. Between A-J.
        column - The column where it's being placed. Between 1-10.
        vert - Whether the ship is vertical or horizontal.
        Returns:
        Whether it was successful or not to place the ship.
